Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not good enough”
Reviews.Author: deedee1204
Reviews.Content: Room is neat and clean (but lighting is a bit dark), yet the hotel has no lobby. You actually have to check in at their sister hotel which is the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal. The breakfast will be at the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal too. No free wiFi provided, you have to pay for about 6Euros for 1 hour which is not worthed. Location is very close to St. Mark's square. Staffs are not so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, but poor service”
Reviews.Author: s0ulffle
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel were beautiful and big, but there are some definite minuses. Firstly, service was not as good. When we arrived, the receptionist was rather curt, and when we asked politely if he could make a reservation at a particular restaurant for us that evening, and he took down our details. When we arrived at the restaurant, there wasn't any reservation made in our name, and fortunately there were 2 last seats not reserved, so we took it immediately. If we were a tad later, we might just have lost the opportunity to eat at that particular restaurant since it was our last night in Venice. We also had to pay quite a bit for internet access (20 euros for 2 days - I had free internet access at similar hotel prices in other cities). For the rooms, simple amenities were given (soap shampoo showercap), but no bathroom slippers. It can get a little cold so if you're bothered, do bring your own. the bathroom is not very well insulated so it was VERY cold after my showers. Quite a torture turning off the shower and grabbing my towel even. It's a shame that such a beautiful hotel is marred by the above. I would not consider staying here in future if I return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great find.....”
Reviews.Author: janeandallen
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Literally behind the western loggia of St Marks Square this is a perfect spot to stay. Just 5 minutes walk from the St Marco vaporette stop it couldn't be easier to find, even for a Venice novice. We had a room up on the top floor. Nice and quiet. Loads of space. Big king size bed and well appointed bathroom. Flat screen tv with all the major european channels. In fact the hotel is like a dormitory outstay ion to the main Hotel Monarco 70 metres away down on the Grand Canal. You have to check in and out there and have your breakfast there as well. But don't let that put you off. Walking 70 metres to have your breakfast on the balcony beside the Grand Canal watching the world go by in the sunshine is no hardship at all. The staff we great and all spoke perfect English and couldn't do enough. I had read some bad reviews about the buffet breakfast, but we thought it was great. Choice of cereals, yoghurt, the usual continental cold meats and cheese, plus cooked eggs, bacon etc. Plenty of juice, fresh fruit and big choice of breads and pastries. Plus all the coffee/tea you could drink brought to your table. You could go a la carte breakfast and pay, but it would be pricey. So overall no complaints, would go back tomorrow. One slightly bizarre groan for bisiting in March was that the air conditioning was switched off and it was quite warm and we discovered that with the windows open the famous Venice Mosquitos had made an early seasonal appearance, do take some room spray and itch cream.

Reviews.Title: “Neat little hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: JCG098
Reviews.Content: This is a cool little hotel in the heart of Venice. The staff were very helpful assisting me with maps and key locations. Rooms are very clean. The price is also excellent for this area ($118 per night). The room had a mini-bar. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: samsam s
Reviews.Content: We had very nice good staying for 4 nights at this hotel.very quiet place even the loction is 2 minutes from piazza San Marco .clean room,2 open windows,we had a bath in our toilet. Room number 705.geat nice stuff very friendly and helpfully.5 minutes from the vaporeto in the canal.as you read the breakfast is serving 5 minutes from the hotel in Monaco Grand Canal. We only mist the Free Wi Fi !

Reviews.Title: “Great find next to P. San Marco!”
Reviews.Author: SIGRAFF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Monaco, but about 300 feet down the street. Check in at Monaco, where you will also have breakfast. Rooms are large by Venice standards--I had a double that was about 14x14, plus a dressing area and a great bathroom. Nothing extravagant: decor is simple, clean, efficient--and since you didn't come to Venice to spend time in the hotel, it's perfect. Location can't be beat--San Marco is right there, 15 min walk to Rialto or Accademia. I got a great price on hotels.com, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: etcarlton
Reviews.Content: The very best thing about this hotel is its location....literally steps away from Piazza San Marco in the heart of Venice. But what surprised me (given the price) was how nice the hotel itself is. The rooms are quite large (again, for Venice) and even have a sitting area and a huge marble shower. Our room had all of the amenities (hair dryer, toiletries, heated towel rack, etc) and was furnished in a modern style, while still retaining the old world charm of leaded windows and beamed ceilings. Check in and out, as well as breakfast are in the larger sister hotel, the Monaco and Grand Canal, which is around the corner from the Selvadego. The Selvadego itself only has a tiny lobby, but everything you need in a front desk is at the Monaco. We booked a package that included dinner at the Monaco, and it was excellent! We were in room 712, on the third floor, and even had a partial view of the canal! A wonderful hotel...I cannot recommend it more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Wont2Travel
Reviews.Content: Quite frankly we were rather jittery about this hotel. During our last visit to Venice, we had stayed at it's sister hotel and knew that this property was located in a separate albeit adjacent building. Since the sister hotel - Monaco & Grand Canal was completely booked (they did offer us ONE room at > â‚¬ 300.00 per night but we were in need of two) we settled for this property and kept our fingers crossed. However, all our fears were laid to rest when we checked into our rooms at the Palazzo Selvadego (608 & 609) Even though the hotel itself is located about a 100m away from the sister property in a rather plain-looking building, both our rooms were quite spacious and 609 took the cake!! It was a duplex with wooden beamed ceiling and had separate areas for the Master bedroom, change room with lots of clothes hangers, a large toilet & separate shower area and an additional study room above, which was connected vide a flight of wooden steps and also contained a single bed. Our check-in was handled smoothly at the tiny lobby (the main lobby is at the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal) and we were informed that breakfast would be served on the main hotel's terrace (between 8 AM and 10:30 AM) which is an overhang on the Grand Canal with lovely views. The hotel is located just behind the St. Mark's Square but not on the Grand Canal - so great location but no views. As has been pointed out in certain earlier reviews, the check-out is a bit of a hassle as one needs to lug heavy luggage down to the other hotel's lobby (about 100 m) Having said that, our check-out was handled quite efficiently and though it required a number of sheets to be printed (for which the front desk was apologetic), it didn't require more than FIVE minutes in total. As it is, if one intends to catch a vaporetto to Santa Lucia / Alilguna to the Airport, one would need to cross the Monaco & Grand Canal to reach the Valaresso / S. Zaccaria stop. I would recommend this hotel for it's location and nicely appointed rooms (with a caveat - the rooms are NOT the usual high ceilinged, headboard painted, Silk-Jacquard curtained, over-the-top furnished, Venetian ones - for that the Monaco is better !!)

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: viola v
Reviews.Content: My friend and my spend a week in June 2010 in this hotel. As many other reviewers have already mentioned the location of the hotel is simply unbeatable. Walk under the arches of the Napoleonic Wing where Correr Museum is located and turn to the right. Here you are! Most rooms have no view which is typical for Venetian houses since they face narrow medieval streets. My friend's room had a view at the roofs, my corner room had two windows overlooking the Hard Roch cafe and gondola parking in front of Hotel Cavaletto. There were absolutely no noise from Hard Rock cafe except usual noises from walking tourists. And tourists walk around the city till 2am. I slept with windows open since I don't like airconditioning, though I used it at day time and it worked fine. The room was not that big but I had a double room for single use so it was OK. The bathroom had no bath but only a shower and was big and well equiped. My friend's room was a little bit bigger but not significantly. The hotel is very clean and very quiet. We never heard or met other guests, only occasionally some chamber-maids. Though hotel has a nice transparent glass elevator (one can see old original brick walls of the building while using it), the building has rather peculiar floor plan so be prepared to walk few steps up or down when you arrive at your floor. My friend had a foot injury before our vacation and this few steps were a problem for him. Check-in is in the sister hotel Monaco and then the porter carried our luggage to Selvadego. On the departure day the luggage was carried by the porter to the main hotel as well. Breakfast was also at the Monaco terrace with breathtaking view. We spent hours at that terrace during breakfast, refreshing at the daytime and having dinner. The restaurant is very good but it is better to make reservation. But even when we didn't book in advance we got a table as hotel guests (though it happened only once, then we tried to make reservation in the morning). The restaurant is very popular, there are guests coming from other hotels and Italians having family dinners and small parties there. The waiters are super nice and friendly. Cocktail Bellini in the bar is much much better than in Harry's Bar which is a one step from the terrace. All the questions should be addressed at the reception in the Monaco hotel, it seems that the receptionist at Selvadego is more a watchman. We made all reservations (water taxi, excursions) at the main receprion.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LordBY
Reviews.Content: Location: very good. In the second San Marco Vaporeto station Room: clean, but small Bathroom: the toilet was in a strange position and there was a flood during shower (see picture...) view: not pleasant (see picture...) room service: good reception: not very nice. breakfast: At the main Hotel: Monaco. Continental style. No buffet. Very good.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced like everything in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Formula1Champ
Reviews.Content: Palazzo del Selvadego is a cheaper wing of Hotel Monaco. The room was nice and clean. The bathroom was very nice too. The location is excellent, right next to San Markâ€™s square and nice high end stores (Louis Vutton bags were cheaper in Venice than US). If you are driving, you can park your car at the garage on the outskirts and take the ferry which will drop you very close to the hotel. But not worthy of $350+ a night stay due to the following reasons 1. Bed linens were scratchy cheap cotton (US motels have better sheets). 2. 14 inch old tv with no in room internet or wifi. You can get wifi in the lobby but they charge you 4 Euros for 15 mins and 8 Euros for 1 hour. 3. Rude receptionist and awkward check out procedure. If you take your own luggage to Hotel Monaco to check out, they ask someone from hotel staff to follow you in spite of having my credit card number. 4. No iron inside the room. They can iron your polo shirt but they want 8 Euroâ€™s for that. 5. The room was dark with little lighting. 6. The free breakfast is ok and we ordered omelet which was ok (had kraft like sliced cheese) but 8 euro extra. I would only recommend if you can get a good deal on the room charge.

Reviews.Title: “We will never come back and will not recommend this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sue B
Reviews.Content: No Lobby, No room service, no restaurant, no internet, very expensive. Some rooms have no elevator. Be prepared to have a room in 6th floor but no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: Karend045
Reviews.Content: As with all the other reviews this hotel is the sister hotel of the Monaco Grand Canal. You check in and check out at the Monaco. When you check in you will be escorted with your luggage to the Palazzo which is about a 5 min walk away. We were given room 620 which also included a seperate sitting room with another TV, cooker, sink, double bathroom, wardrobes etc which was brilliant. If I had to be picky then the bed wasn't particularly comfy and there was only one pillow each. The rooms were also very dark. There was no view we only looked out onto another building. But you will find that you will have so much to do this shouldn't be a problem. It doesn't reallly feel like you are staying in a hotel though, more like a self contained apartment as there is no bar or anything and we saw no other guests at all. On staying here you have the best of both worlds as breakfast is served in the Monaco and you are seated outside overlooking the Grand Canal which is amazing we could have sat here all day. Breakfast is basic a few rolls with jam, tea or coffee. You can pay for extras but they are quite expensive 4 Euros for a bowl of cereal. The waiters are polite but not particularly friendly. The Palazzo Selvadego is literally a 10 second walk from St Marks Square which is really convenient. For the price you pay to stay here compared to the Monaco I would definately recommend this hotel, if you're looking for a bit of luxury then stay at the Monaco but if you are on a tighter budget then this is really good value for money. The water bus from the airport cost 15 Euro's each way and stops outside the Monaco which again is really convenient as it can be difficult wandering round the little streets trying to find your hotel with your suitcases etc as we saw many people doing. If you decide to go on a Gondola then get on outside the Monaco as it cost 80 Euros (per trip not per person) if you get on round the corner at Marks Square it will cost you 150 Euros and at the Rialta Bridge it is 120 Euros all for the same duration of 40 Mins.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing end to an otherwise excellent break”
Reviews.Author: Gillian S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were staying at this hotel for a few days having just completed a cruise to Croatia. The Palazzo del Selvadego is the annexe of the Hotel Monaco and both hotels are in fantastic positions in Venice. The Palazzo is literally steps away from St Marks Square and the Hotel Monaco sits alongside the Grand Canal. The reception on our arrival at the Monaco was superb even though we arrived early in the morning. Our luggage was stored until the room was ready and then taken over to the annexe for us. We were shown to our room soon after lunch (having spent the morning exploring). Our room was nicely furnished and unbelievably large - we had a 6ft bed and a seating area as well as a large shower room. From the moment we arrived we were treated as well as the guests at the main hotel and the service was excellent. When I broke a glass in the bedroom it was immediately dealt with and slippers provided so that there was no chance of either of us getting glass in our feet. Breakfast was taken at the Hotel Monaco, on the terrace - a very basic continental breakfast was included but the views made up for the lack of choice. How disappointing it was then that when I went to settle our bill on the evening before our departure they refused to allow me to do this and insisted that I return in the morning (even though this would mean an extra detour from the annexe with our suitcases). The reception staff were curt to the point of rudeness. They seemed to be worried that we would eat in the restaurant that evening without paying and then empty the room bar. When my husband returned to reception and insisted on settling the account later that night they refused to believe that he had not made the phone call that had been charged to our account. Both episodes left us feeling like second class citizens and we were not sure if this was because we were staying in the annexe or because we had paid for the hotel using airmiles. Loved the hotel but the attitude of some of the staff left a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely staying here again”
Reviews.Author: tsl007
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect. I only tried the breakfast once and it was typical continental breakfast but the view was great. The rooms were clean, the bed were comfortable and the bathrooms was very nice. For the price, this hotel can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect indeed...”
Reviews.Author: Spirit2809
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the 1 problem - NO INTERNET. and by that I mean NO WIFI. It actually made us feel disoriented for a few hours...but once you get used to it...it can be fun.. And now to my review - Our room was 606 - it was great. A bedroom + a bathroom divided into 2 - 1 room with 2 sinks and teh other the restroom + shower. Everything was marble and very esthetic. There are no "view" rooms in this hotel - our room was above a tiny street below and relatively quiet. There is no lobby to this hotel - just an a narrow entrance, very nice transparent elevator. Jorge (gorge?) was the night receptionist and he was extremely nice. This hotel is the baby brother of Hotel Monaco, one of the most luxurious hotels in Venice and breakfast is served there on the terrace. Trust me - it's a good deal :-) a FABULOUS view of the canal, the gondolas and the islands ahead. Add the red geranium and you have a very romantic breakfast for two. Continental breakfast is included. We added 2 things - a plate of cheese (3 pieces of cheese 9 euros!!) and an omlettee which took forever to make...(6.5 euros) - but all in all it was fine - what counts is the amazing view! The hotel is right behind St. Mark's - so the location is the BEST. We came to see the art Biennalle (GREAT) and it's a 15 min walk from there. Someone here wrote about being escorted to the Monaco hotel for check out. No such thing. Actually the receptionist got really pissed off when I asked her about that. To reach the hotel - when you land in venice airport (marco polo) you can take a bus (no 5) to the island to Piazza Roma. We WALKED to the hotel at 22:00 pm - weather was amazing,, suitcase not too heavy - it was great to do the walk. Very easy to get lost...but you'll get there...it's about 30-40 minutes and meanwhile you get to know some of the romantic little spots in Venice...You can take a Vaporretto - bus boat directly from the airport to San Marco - that's about a hour or you can take a taxi boat - that would be much more expensive. a taxi boat from mid Venice to San Marco is ~60 euros...but worth it if you ask me. Especially when it was so hot. All in all - the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Merechat2
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Palazzo del Selvadego based on the reviews from this website. For the most part this hotel was wonderful. The location can't be beat! The hotel was right next to St. Marks square and nearby shopping. There were also quite a few inexpensive places to eat as well. The room seems to be small but really isn't. It's mainly due to the room being broken into different areas. I stayed in room 702 which had an entry/dressing area, a sleeping chamber, and a bathroom to die for! I really enjoyed the room. The view left something to be desired but really who goes to Venice to stay in their room and look out the window? I wasn't too impressed with breakfast. It was just rolls, coffee, and some very nasty powdered juice that I was told was orange juice. Sitting outside on the deck for breakfast at the opening to the Grand Canal was a great way to start the day. Watching the gondoliers ready their gondolas for the was an added bonus! There were two negatives for me about the hotel. First, the walls were paper thin! I could hear the couple in the next room cough and sneeze as if they were in the same room. While I do enjoy hearing Italians arguing passionately; in the middle of the night, not so much. Luckily it didn't last long. The other thing I didn't like about the hotel is with it being an annex of the Hotel Monaco and Grand Canal, guests aren't treated as well as you would expect from a four star hotel. On the day I was checking out, I was leaving the building and the man at the desk told me to give him my key. He then told me he had to escort me to the Hotel Monaco so I don't skip out on my bill! I was pretty miffed! I explained that they had my credit card number and there was no chance of that happening. He told me I didn't have a choice. Of course I walked with him following me at a distance to the other hotel. I'm sure he was a little wary due to the steam coming out of my ears. LOL! I told the woman at the front desk that I found this rude and disrespectful but she just smirked and said people skip out on their bills all the time. It wasn't a good way to end the trip, but it was a nice stay nonetheless. One last thing, if you book your stay on the hotel's website and pick a package. I suggest skipping the one where you can upgrade your room if there is one available. I chose that one and didn't get upgraded even though there was room. I'd go with the shopping discount card instead. It's the same price either way.

Reviews.Title: “Location-location-location”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaT3
Reviews.Content: I actually booked this hotel after reading other reviews on here, so many positives and for the price WOW!!Â  You take water taxi or bus from airport to San Marco, walk over tiny bride under archway and you'll see all major designers and just a few steps is the hotel. It's so easy to get lost in Venice, actually it's quite fun what you stumble across. From any direction you can find a sign to San Marco.Â  Room was small but clean, tv, safe kettle separate bathroom etc all the essentials. No view but I did hear allot of guests complaining at their bigger hotel about the noise on the streets and from the canal, hearing this I was grateful for a sound nice sleep.Â  Breakfast is included and served at the larger hotel with a postcard view, pleasant service basic serving of a fresh baked basket juice and tea or coffee. You can add fruit or hot items for 8-10 Euro.Â  Be sure to ask hotel staff advise on where to eat as Venice is very touristy and I had more bad meals than good ones, the best places I found through asking hotel staff.Â  Late check out and complimentary bag storage a little bonus to make your exit from Venice slightly easier to swallow.Â  Very good experience had here!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ziron3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights during the week in March. As other reviews have said, you check in at Hotel Monaco (steps away from the Vaporetto stop) and a porter takes your bags to Selvadego where they finish the check in process. Our room had a view of an interior courtyard (nothing special) but still allowed plenty of natural night and air to flow in. There was a little kitchenette (though we never used it) and a great bathroom/shower. The location was literally steps away from St. Marks Square, right in the middle of a prime shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great value”
Reviews.Author: flapjack37
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an annexe of the more expensive Hotel Monaco which is a couple of mintues walk away. It is close to St Mark's square - out the door and you're there in less than a minute. You check in at the Hotel Monaco which is close to the vaporetto stop and then a porter takes your luggage to the Selvadego. For breakfast you go to the Hotel Monaco and we were usually given a table overlooking the grand canal with a view to die for. Breakfast is simple and served at your table - juice two rolls, a croissant and a tiny muffin , tea or coffee. Our bedroom was small but adequate, but this is Venice. Being so central is great as you can walk everywhere. We went to a service at St Mark's which was quite an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, space and value”
Reviews.Author: dkbleu
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for Venice, especially if you are visiting for the first time. Perfect location, right next to the piazza San Marco, two turns behind Hotel Monaco (the main hotel where you check in/out). The vaporetto stops to/from the airport and most points along the Grand Canal are a few meters away. The Selvadego has no canal views (Monaco does). We asked for a high floor and got room 711 on the 3rd floor. Very spacious, clean, high ceiling, great bathroom & shower, good supply of toiletries, ample natural light, good ambiance. TV is small but we didn't care. Wifi is not free, even at the main lobby internet access is pricey. Breakfast is served at the Monaco, overlooking the Canal, with a great view of the water traffic and the islands in the south. We had an amazing time in Venice. Make sure you also explore the areas away from San Marco. The strip between Rialto and San Marco is touristy and can get very busy especially in the weekend. Don't be discouraged by some comments about mediocre food. Yes, Venice is not cheap, but there are great choices for food and wine, including some at very reasonable prices. Great seafood tapas and italian-style sashimi, good wine from the surrounding areas (we loved the whites). Check the hotel website for offers. We got one at 390 euros for 3 nights, including basic (continental) breakfast, vaporetto passes for the duration of our stay, and free entry at the casino (didn't go but seriously reconsidered after dropping by nearby B-Bar for a regrettable nightcap).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NikiZante
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, as mentioned by other reviewers - just get off the vaporetto at San Marco and the sister hotel, the Monaco and Grand Canal is right there and they will direct you. We arrived late at night and got put in room 608 - a shoe box - but the next day, at our request, we changed rooms and were given 603 which was much bigger. Although rooms do not have balconies (none of the hotels we saw in Venice had), the central location makes up for it. Breakfast at the Monaco, overlooking the Gondolas on the Grand Canal, was lovely despite the breakfast being basic. Never mind, we used the leftover bread to feed the birds in San Marco! English speaking TV channels were limited (yes I know you shouldnt want to watch TV on holiday, but just now and then you need to rest your weary legs after getting lost in the narrow streets)! If you get the free water taxi from the Monaco to Murano, beware...you feel very pressurised to buy when there. Importantly, the Aliliguna boat tickets (ie 2 or 3 day) are valid on the ACTV water taxis - we didnt find this out until later. The Trip Advisor number 1 rated restaurant, the Al Beneficio (if Ive got that right) was very nice, if a tad pricey. Just follow signs for Al Academia. Harrys Bar (next to the Monaco) was exhorbitant and there was no wine or beer. All in all, we had a lovely time, but I am glad we limited our stay to 3 days, and avoided the height of the season.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: maxpixel
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo del Selvadego is located literally steps away from the western end of Piazza St. Marco so the location is great for sight seeing early in the morning to catch the sunrise and late at night. We found it difficult to find the hotel since there is only a small door into the street which opens up to a larger hotel on higher floors, hovever, the hotel is exactly where it is shown on Google Maps. You have to register at the Monaco Hotel and Grand Canal which is very close to the Piazza St. Marco vaporetto stop on Calle Vallaresso. Once we registered our bags were taken by cart to the Palazzo del Selvadego. This is a 4-star hotel so rooms were spacious and clean and the bathroom appointed in typical Italian luxury although the room was generally spartan. The staff was very helpful and recommended some great restaurants to eat in and gave us a preview of the Carnivale activities for the next few days. For the good value, cleanliness and location I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Koala24
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel with a fancy lobby and reception desk you will be disappointed - you probably should stay at the Palazzo Selvadego's big brother, the Hotel Monaco. That being said, for the price difference, the Selvadego's quirky charm, with open beam ceilings and large, travertine bathrooms are worth the sacrifice. As mentioned in earlier reviews, you check in at the Hotel Monaco, a short jaunt down two alleys away. The staff was very cordial to us and we followed a porter with our luggage on his cart to the Selvadego. The rooms are oddly numbered with the second floor rooms numbered in the 500's (the ground floor is "0" in Europe with the second floor being "1") There are only three floors, so it was hunt and seek for awhile). Although our room did not have a view and overlooked a dirty courtyard, it was very quiet and excellent for sleeping. The room included a very basic continental breakfast at the Hotel Monaco (orange or grapefruit juice; coffee or tea; and assortment of rolls and muffins). The cafe is along the water with a million dollar view of the bustling gondolas and water taxis. San Marco Square is literally steps away from your front door, as is Calle Vallaresso, the street with all the high end designer stores (Gucci, Pucci, etc.) On the day of check out, the hotel arranged for our luggage to be picked up from our rooms and have them waiting for us at the Hotel Monaco lobby, where we caught a private water taxi directly to the airport (the taxi literally pulled up to the hotel). Highly recommended. We enjoyed our stay at the Selvadego and would recommend it to friends who want a hotel with decent rates close to San Marco Square.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellycccc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location. It is a part of the hotel Monaco (bigger hotel) where you can walk to in 2 minutes for breakfast. When we arrived, we were taken by water taxi to the Monaco hotel. They wanted us to check in there. But no where in my documentation did it state that this was the procedure so we were leary of doing this. Therefore, we went directly to the Selvadego to check in. It was easy (but the man at the Monaco was angry that we did not trust him). We were first time travelers in Europe thus we were uncomfortable with checking into another hotel that was not ours. The stay was fantastic. The room was plenty big, bed was about the size of a king bed and it was clean. We enjoyed this hotel so much and you cannot beat the location, right outside St Mark's square. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Forgotmytoothbrush
Reviews.Content: This is a real find. You get all the amenities of the Hotel Monaco (such as the excellent breakfast on a patio facing the grand canal) but for a fraction of the price! Location is excellent - on the corner of St Mark's Square. Security is excellent and the gentlemen on the front desk greet you warmly. Our room was spacious and luxurious and everything was immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel even by European standard”
Reviews.Author: ajalatraveltheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel between from August 8-10 I would not recommend this hotel to someone looking for a 4 star hotel/treatment. I would recommend Hotel Monaco instead. I have never seen a 4 star hotel so basic, it was a rip off. There is no lobby, we even had to go to Hotel Monaco to have our complimentary breakfast that was basically muffin and bread, orange juice and tea. No fruits, bacon/ham/ none of that. Venice is quite small and so space is an issue. But come on, this hotel had a small door as the entrance, you can hardly find it if you didn't know what you were looking for. The guy that mans the desk in the morning/afternoon is a nut job. On the first day we checked into the hotel around 6pm, he was standing at the door. We asked if this what the hotel and he said "what hotel, what's your name" right at the door, blocking the entrance so we could not get in. "Do you have a booking?" We answered yes. He walked to his desk and we followed him and he asked us for our names again. We thought he knew everyone that was checking in that day by heart! Our luggage was misplaced on our flight to Venice and so we didn't have any change of clothes or anything and anytime we called for anything, he would be really snappy, or even hang up the phone without any warning. On getting up to our room, I checked out the bathroom, which had good fixtures, but if you look well, you'll notice that it wasn't thoroughly clean, the towel rack was dusty. I had to clean the towel rack myself so that when they brought in towels the following morning, it would be placed on a clean rack. I then asked for new towels that night, since I couldn't use the ones that were placed there initially. To access the internet, we had to go to hotel monaco's lobby as they didn't have any wireless or cabled internet at the palazzo. We didn't mind paying for it, but no internet wired to the rooms. At Hotel monaco, they charged 9 euros per hour and buying a 24hr time period was not available, incredible eh? I have to mention that we met 2 night shift concierge and they were very helpful, complete opposite to the morning shift guy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, locaton, says it all.”
Reviews.Author: teddi_10
Reviews.Content: We could reach out of our window and touch the back side of St. Marks square. The rooms are small as expected, but have everything, including a kitchen in a storage box. The bathroom is new and has the right european amenities. Lots of hot water and an excellant air conditioner you can control. The breakfast at the Monico on the canal is priceless. Our room did have the view through the buildings to the canal and within a hundred feet so many leather and glass shops. Don't pay attention to a little attitude by a few employees, just smile and you will make their day. We got our ice in a lovely bucket from the Monaco. I definately will return .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab hotel, service could improve”
Reviews.Author: Stevie767
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an annexe of the Hotel Monaco which is located on the Grand canal right next to the first San Marco vaparetto stop. You check in at the hotel and a porter will take you to your room in the Palazzo which is actually even closer to St Mark's square than the Monaco! My room was excellent and cleaned daily to a high standard. I enjoyed my breakfast and the views must be unbeatable as you are sat right on the grand canal with a gondola station right in front of you! The only area the hotel could improve on is the service in the restaurant. There isn't anyone to seat you so you end up milling around unsure of what to do and the waiters are moving that fast that you're unable to draw their attention without seeming rude! Having said that the service is ok once they have seated you, its just a busy place thatâ€™s all and would not stop me from staying here again. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone staying in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and value”
Reviews.Author: tgtoronto
Reviews.Content: If you can forgo the big lobby experience, this hotel, tucked behind St. Mark's among the designer boutiques, is an excellent option. The rooms are lovely and quiet....we felt like we were the only guests there. There were umbrellas at the door (a good idea) It felt like you were staying at a private club since there are no facilities except the rooms. We had some 'attitude' shift at the main lobby of the Monaco when they discovered we were at the 'annex'. From gracious and welcoming to dismissive. Having just read some recent reviews, I have learned that there is a free water taxi to Murano....never mentioned to us. We were denied the free internet and other perks on offer to the 'I Prefer' members as well. Later, I was told I hadn't asked for it. No apology. The man working the desk was rude and dismissive. He literally grabbed the 'I Prefer' flyer out of my hand and said if I was a member then I didn't need one. Although they were happy to help us with our luggage when we arrived, we were told they could not assist us to the vapretto upon checkout. Luckily, it is not too far from the side door of the hotel. The breakfast staff were gracious and the room is lovely, even if you can't sit outside on the canal, which we couldn't because of the rain. You simply can't beat this location if you can stand the snooty staff at the Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “DAMP-COLD-FAB”
Reviews.Author: PAW400
Reviews.Content: By chance we caught the last week of Carnival,we had no idea at time of booking.Which was a bit of a worry at first because we had such a good deal.They seem to have fewer bookings this year than usual.We booked on New Years Day,with hangovers. My wife and I went with two other couples.Went into the tinniest reception,six of us filled it.At that point it all looks like a bit of a mistake,went to our respective rooms, arranged to meet at ours.The other four arrived at our door very boastful of there rooms,until they saw our suite!!!!! Full four poster sofa's etc etc.All 10 secs from the square. Breakfast a short walk away at the big sister hotel Saint Monaco,again FAB. The 3 nights 4 days there were cold, a little damp but a fabulous experience. Photos enclosed.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its promist”
Reviews.Author: rollingstoneSydParis
Reviews.Content: Great location, recently renovated beautifully, we got a great rate through edreams, totally positive experience

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Enjoys_Relaxing
Reviews.Content: It has always been difficult trying to find a balance between location and price when choosing a hotel in Venice. I would like a canal view, but not have to pay an arm and a leg for it. I would like to be close to the major sites, without having to fight through the crowds every day of my trip. I think this property is a good balance. We parked at Tronchetto (cheaper than Piazza Roma) and took the Valperetto to Piazza San Marco. It was quite a walk, particularly if you have luggages with you. If you happen to park at Piazza Roma, then the Valparetto will take you directly in front of the Hotel Monaco (sister property) where you can check in and a porter will transport your suitcases for you to the Palazzo, which is just around the corner. From a location standpoint, it is just adjacent to Piazza San Marco, with high end shopping at your door step, but because it is not located on the main thoroughway into Piazza San Marco, you miss the crowds. Behind the hotel are the maze of streets with local eateries and shops. The Palazzo doesn't have a restaurant, but we ate breakfast at their sister property Hotel Monaco (very simple continental breakfast that is included in our 3 day package rate). Our rate also includes daily valperetto passes which definitely comes in handy when your legs get tired from walking all day long. Our room has an inner courtyard view, and is quiet. We also ate at the restaurant at Hotel Baglioni which was also quite good. On a quiet evening, you could even hear the quartet playing outside the many cafes lining Piazza San Marco. No canal view for us, but we took enough valperetto rides to compensate for that. And as usual, rain led to local flooding resulting in the neccessity to walk on planks around town.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: IrnBruzer
Reviews.Content: Literally 10 seconds walk from St Mark's square there can be few hotels in better locations for a short stay in Venice. Our room was definitely on the small side - 18 inches space between bed and walls with a small hall area. Breakfast is a minute or so walk away at the Hotel Monaco where tea/coffee. orange juice is provided along with a small basket of pastries/rolls/biscotti - perfectly fine for a start. Other items are available at a huge charge even by Venice standards (4 euros for a yogurt!). Service at breakfast wasn't great - despite ordering tea with milk each of our 3 mornings, every day we had to request the milk later when it didn't arrive. But the great location means this is still a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room with Romantic Ambience”
Reviews.Author: dvmv
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I stayed in the Palazzo del Selvadego as part of a 10-day Globus Tour, therefore our check-in was fairly straight forward. Our room was very spacious - exposed beams, raked ceiling, polished floors, TV, Fridge. Room was air conditioned and had 3 large windows 2 overlooking other buildings and one the alleyway to St Marks square. Bathroom featured a double marble sink, Large shower which was great to hang clothes to dry ample toiletries and a high powered hair dryer. Room was serviced daily including fresh sheets, towels and toiletries. Breakfast was served in a room of the Hotel Monaco only a short walk away an experience in itself - the ballroom next to it and the beautiful staircases were majestic. Variety of choices for breakfast with fruit, yoghurt, crossaints, cheese, ham and eggs, coffee plus tea on request. I think that as Aussie s we are used to more outgoing staff in our hospitality industry. Staff in dining room not overly friendly and we wondered if it had something to do with having to deal with tour groups. Our understanding is that the hotels cater for the nationality of the group - ours was mainly "american" continental breakfasts. I thought this hotel did well - same menu every day (included in our tour)but we had other restaurants to choose from if we wanted. We tried to immerse ourselves in the culture & having an Italian background we just ate and drank what was available. We found that a few people on our tour weren't as accepting of what was on offer and were often offended if they didn't have access to their usual foods. Our view was if the coffee was too strong - water it down, or have juice rather than complain - Location was fantastic - very central and our room was on the corner and backed onto another building and alley way to St Marks Square and was extremely quiet. Very close to Ferries so not a long trip with suitcases. Desk staff were helpful - I locked my suitcase with the keys in it and discovered this on our return from dinner at 10.30pm. I went downstairs to desk and asked for assistance and young man came and unlocked it for me straight away - no problems. One thing we did notice is that throughout our stay as a group there was a variation in the size and amentities in each room - some had a kitchenette, some didn't have a fridge or a bath only etc . So when looking at accommodation we would advise double checking and requesting specific facilities eg. shower if you are elderly -

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: slpnbuety2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and was only in it for maybe 10 minutes and it looked great. But they told me they had upgraded me to their sister Hotel Monaco at Grand Canal, which is the #1 rated hotel in Venezia. I wasn't sure why they upgraded me, and I didn't want to pay the bill for Hotel Monaco (over $350 eu/night) and they just said they did that from time to time and sent me on my very happy way to Hotel Monaco. They even had someone take me and my luggage over to the other hotel. What an awesome experience in customer service!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: missfitVictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from July 20 to July 23. The room was beautiful and spacious. The check in was done at the Grand Monaco just off the Grand Canal from the Vaporetto stop. The Palazzo is just 1 minute from San Marco Piazza. The rooms have no view or lobby but just out the door to the left and you are right in the Piazza. The breakfast is served at The Grand Monaco outdoor terrace looking out on The Grand Canal. They say they offer continental breakfast which only consist of juice and pastries everything else is on the menu and quite expensive. I suppose you have to pay for the view. We had one dinner at the Hotel. The service and the food was excellent. If you are coming from the train station you can take the vaporetto #1 which stops right in front of the Grand Monaco where you have to check in. They will then take you and your luggages to the Palazzo. Safe and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great in so many ways!”
Reviews.Author: saaripor
Reviews.Content: perfect location and great value for location/hotel quality/friendly staff. just perfect for a short trip to romantic venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant staff, clean”
Reviews.Author: 123jade
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great base for the main sights in Venice. It is clean and modern. Staff were helpful and polite. Breakfast overlooking the bustling waterway is beautiful and takes your mind off the poor selection of pastries and one glass of orange juice. You can pay extra for a more substantial breakfast. If I returned to Venice I would stay in this hotel again. Tip - when finding the hotel it might be useful to have a good idea what it looks like as the signage is very small. It is surprisingly easy to find, if you arrive by waterferry turn left and head for the hotel monaco and grand canal and follow the streets to St Marks Square.

Reviews.Title: “Location and breakfast make small room worth it.”
Reviews.Author: kingarthur
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here May 2009. The hotel is perhaps 100m from the main hotel 'Monaco & Grand Canal'. The room was small but location is everything. (It might eb a bit small for staying a week, but was fine for 3 nights.) Our room on a corner had a lovely view from one window over a gondola station on a side canal (see photo). The room looked down on the Hard Rock Cafe but there was no significant noise. At night the location was wonderfully peaceful. This venue is probably slightly closer to St Marks Square than the Monaco & Grand Canal. Breakfast is the highlight. You enjoy a normal continental breakfast at the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal and can eat on the terrace looking straight out onto the mouth of the Grand Canal. You watch the waterbuses coming and going to the adjacent stop and the gondoliers, who have parked overnight right beside you, unpacking their gondolas ready for a day fleecing the tourists. (Ripping them off). Their is a gondola pier beside the hotel so you can watch the earliest tourists heading out as well. Breakfast itself was fine - though cover your bread basket to stop the little birds coming and helping themselves. There are a la carte breakfast items which you can add if you want more. Staff were pleasant and made no distinction in their treatment of guests from the annex. You can check in directly at the Palazzo Selvadego, but if in doubt about finding it go the the Monaco & Grand Canal and a porter will wheels your bags over and show you to your room. If you get the waterbus in from the airport get off at San Marco and take a left. Over one bridge and you are at Harry's Bar which is opposite the entrance to the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal. It would be only 2/3 minutes walk to the hotel and the Palazzo Selvadego is only a minute or two further. For 12 walking tours of Venice buy the book "Brunetti's Venice" by Toni Sepeda. Got us to places we would otherwise have missed as the book retraces the footsteps of the fictional policeman Commissario Brunetti from novels by Donna Leon. Those novels also give you a flavour of Venice (and tourists) from a local's point of view. Our trip included a Monday (when some things in Venice are closed) but the three nights for the price of two deal with Hotels.com brought our cost to about GBP360 - say 570 US dollars. Great value for two people staying in the heart of Venice and breakfasting in such a spot. Our room shared the same canal view as the Best Western Hotel Cavalletto - seen in one of my photos. Its rates and reviews might be worth checking out as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne79
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo del Selvadego is small and hard to find. You have to check in at the Hotel Monaco and then walk to this hotel. Hotel room was very noisy and staff....especially at the Hotel Monaco was rude and not helpful. Hotel had air conditioning, but did not work very well. Room was clean but bed had linen sheets that were not comfortable, AT ALL. Bed mattress was not very comfortable either. Very noisy outside of hotel till late at night. Hotel is located right by the Piazza of San Marco and close to the water. That was the only plus about this hotel. I would not reccommend this hotel. For the money, it was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful option”
Reviews.Author: OntarioMapleleaf
Reviews.Content: This is great value due to location and service. It is small, but has all the necessary touches. The staff was helpful, the rooms clean, the bed excellent, the location near all the "must see" places. The only possible negative was that there was no real view and the room was small. In spite of this, it was a great stop for a single traveller and I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central, cheap for Venice, but a bit charmless.”
Reviews.Author: HoppyEu
Reviews.Content: The big plusses for this hotel are: - its link with the much plusher Hotel Monaco Grand Canal, which means you get to have breakfast on their terrace actually on the Canal; - its very very central location - right next to St Mark's Sq. - its quietness, mostly because there are no cars in Venice, so even if you have a room on the street, it's quiet at night - helpful staff; - generally good standard of cleanliness, but under bed had not been swept for some time. The room was a good size; well furnished in a modern style ( only one armchair, though there was easily room enough for a sofa) ; good beds, plenty of storage space, good bathroom; good shower. The minuses are: - Because it's a kind of annexe, you don't get any of the services or atmosphere you might expect in such an expensive hotel - there's not even a lobby to sit in, because you enter directly off the street into a tiny Reception area where there's the lift and stairs to rooms. For this reason, it sometimes feels lonely here - you only see other guests on the stairs. - no BBC on the TV! - tea-making facilities, but no milk - so you can't actually have a cuppa! - the breakfast is enough, but not the buffet style breakfast I would expect for these prices: only rolls, juice and coffee (no fresh fruit, cheeses, hams, let alone anything cooked) (unless you pay the very stiff prices of the Monaco).

Reviews.Title: “Poor attitude spoiled it for me !”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: After the positive reviews of this hotel, I was really looking forward to my stay, but Iâ€™m afraid I came away disappointed. While I could not fault the location at Piazza san Marco, there were other aspects of this property and the Monaco that really annoyed me. Firstly, the attitude of everyone who worked at the Monaco â€“ it was like they were doing us a favour. The breakfast was dire and when we asked if we could sit on the balcony they said: â€œno, too much botherâ€�. How charming. We also requested late check-out (just an hour) and were just told no. We pleaded and when one of the front-of-house staff at the Monaco was just about to give in, the Manager stepped in and stopped her. I guess it was too much bother for him too! I would have to say that the room had the best shower I have ever seen in a European hotel. It was a shame that they only provided soap, shampoo and bath gel as their amenities. And would it have killed them to have provided a flat-screen TV? The air-conditioning in the room had not been turned on yet, which meant the room was either hot and stuffy, or when the window was opened -- very nosy and smelly due to the street activity outside. Overall, I would have to say I was disappointed with Venice in general on this trip. It all seemed to be about money and how best to part the tourists from every Euro in their pocket. The service industry (both in the hotels and restaurants) has a lot to be desired and with the growing world recession, might have to change their poor attitude. .

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel & breakfast at the Monaco!”
Reviews.Author: ashley_in_TO
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel right beside the arches to Piazza san Marco. Breakfast down the street at the opulent Hotel Monaco was a treat - right on the canal. The pillows were a bit of an afterthought. You actually have to check out at the Monaco at the end of your stay, but it's very easy, and the people are very helpful in general. Great chic restaurant "Osteria/Enoteca san Marco" up the street 1 block.

Reviews.Title: “Wow... Above and Beyond....!”
Reviews.Author: JoeJourneys
Reviews.Content: This residence is part of the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal so finding it was a bit of a challenge.. you need to check into the hotel and a porter will walk you 2 minutes to the Palazzo del Selvadego Hotel just behind San Marco Square.. what a surprise to find it in a perfect location! The hotel and room went above and beyond what I had expected, large rooms, clean and modern bathrooms... it was really a taste of luxury! Breakfast is at the main hotel but this means breakfast alongside on the Grand Canal. This exceeded all expectations and offered a great value for money... in such a beautiful city it certainly added to the experience. I have no doubt this is the first place I would consider should I ever have a return visit to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: s.h.
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and was absolutely delighted with the experience. We booked 2 single rooms, but I had a double bed in my room and my mother had a huge twin with 2 armchairs and a coffee table. Positives: 1. Very comfortable beds, with clean linen and towels every day. 2. A fabulous shower that refreshed you even after a typically exhausting Venice day. 3. Great air-conditioning, under your own control. Despite being October, the weather was circa 22/24 C (Summer in Scotland!) and we really needed it. 4. Great curtains which made the room lovely and dark even in the sunny mornings. 5. Tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. 6. Very quiet in rooms, despite its location. 7. Friendly, professional staff. 8. (This should be number 1) There is no breakfast room, which means that you have it at the Monaco and Grand. Because of the weather, this meant breakfast on the terrace right on the Grand Canal. This was sublime: that time became a highlight of every day. Yes, it was only a Continental but well worth that trade off for the location. 9. Check in/out at the Monaco and luggage portered between the two. Very useful, as then a shorter walk to the Aglilaguna stop. Negatives: Can't think of any at all! This was my 4th trip to Venice and I have stayed in different hotels each time. I will always try to come back here in future, availability allowing, and would wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best location ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ashe17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the double room for three nights: Positives: - Best location ever, it is literally around the corner from St Mark's Square, which was our favourite place in Venice. From the hotel you can explore Venice on foot or take the waterbus. - The room was clean and comfortable and had a great bathroom and shower. - There was a safe and plenty of space to put your luggage. - Plenty of restaurants close by. - Breakfast was served at their sister hotel, Hotel Monaco Grand Canal. Breakfast was simple but good quality and fantastic views of the grand canal. Wake up early, its worth it! Negatives: - Check in and out is at the Hotel Monaco Grand Canal which is much easier to find. This was not communicated to us earlier. - The staff at the check in desk at the Hotel Monaco Grand Canal were stuck up and unhelpful. Cordial at best. But it didn't matter too much because apart from checking in and out you don't have any other contact with them. The staff at the Palazzo are much more friendlier. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Will Always Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: pamelas111
Reviews.Content: This was the most wonderful hotel in the most perfect location!! Steps from the vaporetto, shopping, food and St. Marks - you can walk anywhere from here!! The room was wonderful and the pictures that we saw online did not do it justice. Large bathroom - very clean. Only downside was the breakfast at the Monaco Grand and I would just recommend skipping that (go only for a cappucino if you like) but I would just walk towards Rialto Bridge and stop at one of the bars along the way. We had a wonderful stay at this hotel and will most definitely stay here on our next visit.!

Reviews.Title: “The best room I've stayed in to date”
Reviews.Author: just-another-TA
Reviews.Content: We ended up having to book a last minute hotel after leaving the Venezia Residence Apartment we had originally booked- we were therefore time constrained as we needed the hotel on the same night, within the next two hours! We saw this hotel being close to St MArks and hoped it would be atleast slightly better than the apartments we were leaving- this place exceeded our expectations- The staff are very friendly and courteous and very helpful. We stayed in the suite which was well decorated, modern, and had a great shower and bath. We had two sinks which was great for us though not necessary, and a dining area in the room. At times the air conditioning did not work but the staff readily did their best to resolve this for us. The beds were very comfortable and being so close to St Marks Sq (about a 2mins walk if that) made this a great hotel- Complimentary breakfast was provided at their sister hotel Hotel Monaco and Grande Canal, which overlooks the canal and its beautiful to sit there for breakfast right beside the sea. WE were also provided a complimentary private taxi boat to Murano from the hotel and this was great for us to see how glass was made and the like. They also offered us free tickets to the local casino but this wasn't something we were interested in. I would definitely recomment Hotel Monaco and Grand Canal and its sister hotel Palazzo Salvadego to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CyberAynne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a Globus Tour. Our room was large and interesting. The hotel has a maze of halls and and stairs and felt very antique. I could see St. Mark's Square from my window. There is no restaurant but they serve breakfast at the Monaco and its included in your room cost. Overall a good place to stay if you are not looking for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ClemW9
Reviews.Content: We (5 of us) stayed at the Palazzo del Selvadego for 3 nights last week, I have to say this hotel have the perfect location for a city break. The water bus from airport stop 20 yard from the Hotel Monaco where we check in, then a short walk (30 yards) accompanied by a member of staff to the PS. We love the fact from outside, the hotel looks like a normal residence, and St. mark's Sq only 20 yards away. The rooms are spacious, and tastfully decorated, bathroom are big and clean, and certainly no bad smell. Breakfast at the Monaco are good and not a problems for the short walk, even though it rains 2 out of 3 mornings, no further than the walk to breakfast than some big resort hotel. The concierges work at the small entry are friendly and very helpful, they answer any queries from restaurant to trian time, tide level to weather .. etc. One morning when we are on our way to have breakfast, he realise the water will be high, so he pick up the phone, call the Hotel Monaco, and ask somebody to open the back door for us to get in, (the front entrance of Hotel Monaco are flooded), very thoughtful. I know somebody will argue there's not much of a view out of the window and the room can be dark in day time. But most tourist don't spend much time in their room on city break, and it will be a crime to visit a city as beautiful as Venice without wandering around all day long. To top it up, Â£80 a night in 'Venice' from expedia, you just cannot complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TIDE2124
Reviews.Content: We were there for three nights. The room was very large, the bath had a great shower and breakfast was overlooking the Grand Canal what more could we ask. The hotel is at the San Marco water bus stop making it perfect to get around Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: marggis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, and the location could not be better. Rooms are amazing, huge, super comfortable, including the bathroom. It is a very modern fairly either new or remodeled hotel. It's in partership with Hotel Monaco Grand Canal, so you go every morning to the amazing location to eat a great breakfast with fresh orange juice with the view of The Grand Canal. The service was excelent. From our room you could see the entrance to Piazza San Marco. We went for our honeymoon and we loved it. We booked a package, wich included a trip to Murano, and they also gave us 2 tickets to visit the Casino, and a Vivaldi CD. It was one of the best parts of our trip. I would definitely go there again, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: srbjsim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel March 13-16 2007. Overall, the room had a very nice decor and the most comfortable bed during my time in Italy. The hotel is located near San Marco Square and is at perfect location. The only negative is the breakfast which is at the Hotel Monocco Grand Canal. The breakfast consists of some dry muffins, juices, and hot beverages. If you get a good price I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury beside San Marco piazza”
Reviews.Author: AudreyO
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and 4 others on (-) as we all attended a conference in Venice. As the 'sister' hotel of the Grand Monaco, a member of the Summit group, it is the cheaper option, but with most of the benefits... The rooms are in a large unnamed building, literally around the corner from the Piazza San Marco. Very modern, with dark woods, marble bathroom, coffee making facilities and comfy beds. Surprising quality for such a low price in central Venice. You check in at the Monaco, located beside the San Marco vaperreto stop (again unmarked so watch out for it on the LHS!!), and your bags are brought the 50m or so to the Palazzo. Staff are very friendly. Breakfast is taken at the Monaco, which has an amazing view on the lagoona... My only advice would be to ask for a double room at the BACk, away from the street, which can be just a little noisy, but not during the night. everyone thanked me for finding this gem!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: KateAp
Reviews.Content: We booked the Selvadego on the evidence of Trip Advisor reviews and stayed there for two nights, November 18th and 19th. While the decor of the room was perfectly pleasant and the palazzo itself amazingly well situated for St Marks Square, there was one thing (and its consequences) that really spoiled our stay. That thing was the heating, which in the entrance, lobby and landings was verging on tropical; and while our room itself wasn't quite so warm, the centrally operated air conditioning didn't work and it was impossible to sleep in comfort. So... we opened the windows - great plan, enjoy a bit of ventilation... BUT the downside of being close to the Square then became evident as we were kept awake by the comings and goings and to make matters worse, we established that Venice's mosquitos are alive and kicking in November and still have a healthy appetite for human beings. So, by Monday morning, having spent most of Saturday and Sunday nights sleepless (being bitten to bits and chasing blood sucking mozzies around the room rather than for any more enjoyable reason....) we'd had enough. Summary would be, on balance OK but check the air-con's been fixed before you book

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Des-Cork
Reviews.Content: We stayed her in mid november. Most earlier reviews were enthusiastic, but a few were critical. Having stayed there I cannot understand how anyone would not be delighted. As everyone says the location cannot be beaten in Venice. We took the No. 1 vaporetto (water bus) from the station. It cruised the Grand Canal which is the best introduction to Venice. The first door on the left when we got off at San Marco was the entrance to the main hotel - ,Monaco & Grand Canal.' We checked in at the main hotel reception, and were escorted the 75 yards to the palazzo by a porter carrying our bags in a fancy trolly. The concierge there checked our passports and issued a key. (a second key was no problem when we asked). The service was helpful, efficient and friendly (but not too friendly. This is a high class, sophisticated hotel, not an Irish B & B). The room was beautiful with furniture, fittings, bed linen towels etc. all a first class standard. It was one of the smaller in the Pallazo, but was big enough. It did not have much of a view, only walls and roofs. We had booked a standard room. It was very quiet. On a previous stay, in another hotel we had a lagoon view. It was stunning but the noise the water traffic makes at night was incredible. There were some nice touches. We dropped in some shopping bags to the concierge when we were passing, and they had been taken to our room when we returned. We were leaving Venice at 5pm. The concierge advised us to check out at the main hotel after breakfast. He said we could use the room until 12 and leave our bags there. When we returned at 5, our bags were waiting for us at the main hotel reception. We treated ourselves to dinner in the hotel restaurant with fabulous views of the Grand canal. It was one of the most memorable melas we have ever had. The service was superb, food interesting and excellent, and ambience unbeatable. The cost for four couses was 152 euros for the two of us. We are both teetotallers so there is no wine included) It was wirth every cent. We booked on the internet. The cost for three nights (including breakfast) was 420 euros for the two of us. (November) We loved our stay and recommend it unreservedly. Oh! and Venice was as majical as ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better than Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: LouieGroup
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid August and location was hard to beat. Piazza San Marco is the place to be, but everything is within an easy walk or vapretto(boat). The room was very up to date in contrast to a building with history. Breakfast at the Hotel Monaco was basic, but service and view are great. Restaurant Al Gazzettino was great, and only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: cxb56
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent. The concierge at the Grand Monaco, the main hotel, accomodated us with complimentary water taxis to Murano, reservations for transportation to the airport, and tips on sites to see. The rooms were large by European standards and the location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Selvagego...not quite a "Palazzo" but more than satisfactory!”
Reviews.Author: Croydon_Explorers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3 rooms at the Selvadego at the end of August (pics are of room 608). This is an annex to the main Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal (M&G) which is a two minute walk away. It's a good idea to check-in here first, they will then escort you and transport your luggage to the Selvadego. We found the staff helpfull and all spoke English. The three rooms were of varying sizes (ours was the smallest - although still a decent size by European standards), all had good en suites. It is modern, clean and comfortable but not as plush as it's "grand" parent...but you get what you pay for! Breakfast was inclusive and on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal at the M&G - fantastic views! Breakfast consisted of fruit juice, tea/coffee, bread, croissants, muffins, jams, etc. Other items could be purchased at extra cost. The Selvadego is ideally located immediately outside the west end of St Mark's Square and this, coupled with breakfast on the Grand Canal and the price of rooms are probably the main reasons for choosing this hotel. Would I stay here again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Want to feel like a second class citizen?”
Reviews.Author: Davidian
Reviews.Content: Just back from the magical city of Venice and stayed at Palazzo del Selvadego and I have to say I was disappointed by the hotel.I booked it based on the reviews I read here.On our first morning we were treated to the delights of a cold shower, when we asked reception why was this they just said it must be a problem with the building and no further explanation or apology was forthcoming.Not to worry, a wonderful day of discovery awaits you in Venice.We return in the late afternoon for a siesta to find that our room has not been made up.Call reception again and they then send someone to our room and are told to wait outside until they finish.Not the kind of service I was expecting.Basically you are farmed out from the San Marco to this splendid little location but you always have the feeling of being a second class citizen.The people on reception in San Marco will basically look down on you as such.Be warned that you do not even have wireless internet in Palazzo del Selvadego.Also with your breakfast in San Marco you get basic coffee and some breads but any of those tempting things on the breakfast menu will be charged to your room(they tried to charge us â‚¬112 instead of â‚¬12 one morning on the bill).I hate to complain but for such a highly rated place I was left feeling a little short changed by this place, especially after arriving from The Regent Esplande in Zagreb where the staff in San Marco should be sent for some lessons in how to treat customers.

Reviews.Title: “Superior in every way”
Reviews.Author: LisaGoldsmith
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Venice was amazing in every way - this is a magical and unique city for any traveler. The stay at Palazzo Selvadego made the visit even more special; we felt like visiting dignataries. I learned from previous reviews to check in at Hotel Monaco on the Grand Canal. We were escorted around the corner via upscale shopping streets and past the west entrance to Piazzo San Marco to Selvadego. The service was personal and friendly with suggestions and support that helped us plan our visit. The complimentary breakfast at Hotel Monaco was wonderful, right on the Grand Canal! Most important advice: use the internet specials and book in advance - the cost is substantially better.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: buckliew
Reviews.Content: I have been to Europe at least eight different times. This is by far the largest hotel room I have ever stayed at in Europe. But the size isn't everything. It is also clean, by my wife's standards, and very convenienty located. Our room was right above the Ermenegildo Zenga's store, which I love. We were a stone's through from St. Marks Square, and we had Belini's at Harry's every night.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: KK
Reviews.Content: This is the sister hotel to Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal. We wanted to stay one more night in Venice and there wasn't room at the Hotel Monaco so they put us here. The rooms was big. The shower was huge. They had a real blow dryer in the bathroom instead of the ones that are attached to the wall and that don't do a good job. The hotel is located right behind St. Mark's (it's above the Zegna store). They don't have a restaurant but you can take to the short walk over to the Hotel Monaco if you want the free continental breakfast or any other meals. The staff here was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for first visits”
Reviews.Author: Tubster
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Venice for her birthday and stayed at the Selvadego. I had been to Venice before, but its location makes it easy for anyone to find. Waterbuses call at San Marco stop, right outside the Hotel Monaco & Grand, which is where we checked in. A water taxi would have cost around 55 euros from Piazzale Roma, a return on the waterbus cost 9 euros each. A porter then carried our luggage around the corner to the Selvadego. The room we had was very large by European standards, immaculately clean, and the gents on the reception desk were, without exception, very friendly, helpful and polite. The view from the terrace of the Monaco, where breakfast is served, is wonderful.A basket of muffins, rolls, etc is included in the price.Hot dishes, fruit etc are available at extra charge. I found these prices reasonable considering you are in a major tourist destination in Europe, sat on a terrace overlooking the Grand Canal! Our only niggles with the room, was that it really needed extra lighting, such at a few lamps, or even main ceiling lighting. All we had in our room was some soft lighting above the curtains, and the lights at the side of the bed. Great location, every member of staff both in the Monaco & Selvadego were extremely pleasant,and very clean (our beds were changed every night we were there). We had a great stay.(and Venice wasn't too bad either!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shaun01
Reviews.Content: This is really an excellent hotel which as stated before is not the poor relation to the Monaco. A good tip is to check in at the Monaco which is easy to find and you will be escorted with your lugage to the Palazzo which though nearby is hard to find. Breakfast which though modest for a hotel of such standing is a delight as it is served on the terrace of the Monaco which looks over the bay. Venice need not be expensive, The Rialto market area which while still quite central is great value for food and drink, we were paying 3 euro for 2 v nice Sauvigon Blancs, it is a cliche but if the locals are in then use it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Friends recommended the Monaco and Grand Canal Hotel, the plush â€œsisterâ€� hotel of the Palazzo del Selvadego. However, after checking Tripadvisor, we found that the Selvadego was a fabulous value. We stayed 8 nights and had a large (by European standards), well appointed room with a seating area could be moved into several positions for various uses. The huge bath was newly tiled and included a hair dryer, bidet, and a make up mirror. There was a separate closet with a safe and a small dressing area. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is just off of San Marco square, so the location is excellent. However, the hotel is difficult to locate as there is little signage. Go to the Monaco and Grand and let them take you the 2 blocks to Selvadego for your initial visit. The hotel is situated in the middle of designer shops, jewelry stores, delis, etc. The price includes a continental breakfast at the Monaco Hotel in a room overlooking the Grand Canal. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMitchell
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here from 9.3.06; staff polite and efficient, the hotel ideally located centrally, near St Mark's Square. Room was immaculate though small, with modern amenities. My only gripe was poor insulation in the floors, guests above easily heard walking on the wooden floors. The drains gurgled through the room from 07:30, so I hope you're a heavy sleeper if you stay here! Do: look for quiet authentic family restaurants outside the busy central triangle:cheap with excellent fresh food. Do: visit the Rialto market; silk ties for 8 euros, and equally cheap scarves. Don't: bother with a bellini at Harry's Bar, a sweet small wine/fruit juice, scarily expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Laura Berk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3-09-06, based on Trip Advisor reviews. I cannot say enough about this place; it is simply perfect. The staff is very helpful, the room is very spacious, with a wonderful bathroom. You can make tea in the room, and the breakfast overlooks the Grand Canal at the Monaco. I was concerned about transportation; don't worry. There's a waterbus for 2.5 euro to the train station, and the waterbus to the airport is 5 euro. The hotel is just around the corner from St. Mark's Square. We stayed throughout Italy, and this hotel is simply the best. I reserved online in advance and got a great room for less than $150 USD through a sea creature travel site.

Reviews.Title: “Not the poor stepchild!”
Reviews.Author: brezza
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of the reviews on trip advisor. When I booked with the Monaco and Grand Canal , they were a bit surprised I would want to stay in the annex as opposed to the main hotel; there was availability in both. I had a deluxe double room with canopy bed, the style was modern in a sophisticated way- dark woods and clean lines. There was a furniture â€œcubeâ€� that you can open to reveal a sink, burner and dish drainer. A boiler and a selection of teas was available as well. Breakfast was just a 2 minute walk to the hotel Monaco and Grand Canal with a dreamy view of the lagoon. I saw the rooms in the â€œmainâ€� part of the hotel and canâ€™t figure out why this is the â€œstepchildâ€�â€”I liked it much more! Excellent value- just steps from San Marco too!

Reviews.Title: “Rekindling the magic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a couple of nights at the Palazzzo Selvadego and we were very impressed. It was our first break away from our young daughters and we were looking for a centrally located quality hotel without having to break the bank. As Venice, and the hotel, was quite quiet we were given an upgrade to a huge room/suite on the top floor (712) and we were both delighted with the space and standard of the fittings. We had a double walk-in shower (with three shower heads?), double sinks and a B&O television. The location of the hotel was perfect, just a minute walk from San Marco in a doorway next to the Ermengildo Zegna shop and a couple of minutes from the Monaco hotel where breakfast was served. The view from the breakfast room at the Monaco - the Grand Canal and a gondola station - was worth the cost of the hotel alone.
