So, if you want a quality hotel room and don't mind staying in the annexe of a larger hotel the Palazzzo Selvadego could be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: PaddyBathEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annexe over christmas and were highly delighted with the location, friendliness of all staff and very comfortable room. We enjoyed breakfast overlooking the water and gondolas and felt we were in a magical place. The evening meal was superb! All staff were very helpful and security was excellent. Well done to all staff and very many thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, I booked four nights at this hotel as a birthday present for my husband. It was a wonderful hotel and even in winter, walking to the Monaco (the grand sister hotel) for breakfast was no problem at all. The location is so convenient and I had no problem in using the concierge service to book concert tickets etc. Everything was as easy as possible. When leaving, the concierge at the Monaco booked our water taxi, arranged to have our luggage loaded and called us when it was all ready - to escort us to the taxi. This level of service at those prices was truly excellent. My one small gripe (and this wouldn't stop me going back) is that when we arrived, we were asked that one of us sign in and provide an imprint of a credit card. As it was my birthday gift to my husband, I took the pen to sign and got out my credit card. The concierge gave me a funny look and told me that the man must sign etc. As I had booked and paid for the whole trip myself as a gift for my lovely husband - I felt annoyed that he had to get out his credit card because mine, as a women, wasn't accepted. It made me feel like I wasn't being allowed to pay for my own gift to my husband. Humiliating and annoying for me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for first-timers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is an off-shoot of the bigger and more expensive Hotel Monaco down the street -- it's essentially like a doorman apartment building: no lobby, restaurant, etc. And that's what makes it so great. You don't feel like you're staying in some stuffy hotel, you feel like you're in a real Venice apartment. The rooms - or at least our double room - are huge by European standards, almost as big an an American hotel room. Cozy even in winter with your own thermostat, big closet. Big, spacious marble bathroom with a great shower and tub. As others have mentioned, there is no room service and you have to walk to the Monaco for breakfast, but it's literally a block away. What's so great about this place for first-timers to Venice is its location, about 20 feet from Piazza San Marco. Since there are signs all over town pointing you to S Marco, you can always find your way back home. Also, it's right next to the San Marco stop for the Alileguna water bus to/from the airport. A final highlight: the friendly doormen who lend you boots when the city floods. Only complaint: the "internet connection" they advertise is a data port on the phone, so unless you can dial-up and pay the expensive phone call rates, don't count on getting online here.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with that someone special in Venice for a long weekend recently and after careful surfing picked the Palazzo del Selvadego to stay. Overall, I was extremely impressed. Arrival was stress free, following a 40 mins Vaparetto journey from the Place de la Roma bus terminus. We alighted at St Marks jetty with the Hotel Monaco clearly in view for check in. The best thing about this hotel is its location - literally just a stones throw from St Marks in the designer shops district. Breakfast was served in the Hotel Monaco dining rooms, with views of the grand canal and gondolas bobbing on the waters. Lying in bed, you could just hear the bells ringing across the city in the morning, which was very romantic. The room was modern and very comfortable, albeit a little on the small side (my only negative comment)...with fashionable decor and a lovely bathroom/wetroom. Maybe it was just a one off, but by far the cheapest rate for this place was to be found by searching on the site that's better known as an eight legged sea creature. My one must do: get to the top of the bell tower at the end of the day as the sun is setting over a crowd free St Marks. Stunning views of Venice that we will always remember. Definately my Cary Grant moment. Oh, and if your there "on the hour" then prepare yourself for some stunning noise too!!

HotelInfo.Name: Palazzo Selvadego
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 1124/B, 30124 Venice, Italy
